alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 8:37PM EDT until July 24 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Fairfield County in central Ohio... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 837 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Baltimore, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. * Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Reynoldsburg, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Millersport, Pleasantville, Fairfield Beach, Thurston, Carroll, Fairfield County Airport, State Route 158 at State Route 204 and Dumontville. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 112 and 113. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
